metadata.title: Thomas Jefferson's First Inaugural Address (analyzed by Claude 3.7 Sonnet)
metadata.summary: Jefferson's inaugural address demonstrates a strong commitment to positive moral values while showing minimal presence of negative elements. The speech emphasizes dignity across partisan divides, truth-seeking, hopeful vision, justice for all citizens, and pragmatic governance. It deliberately avoids tribalism, fear-mongering, resentment, manipulation, and fantasy solutions. The high MPS (0.9) confirms its preference for positive moral values over negative ones.
